intro: Vernonia hoffmanniana, commonly known as the Hoffmann's ironweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellow to orange-red disc-shaped flowers. The plant produces rough, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in grasslands and open woodlands. The genus Vernonia is part of the Asteraceae family, known for its composite flower heads.
